notes: This matrix is a traceability artifact, not an assertion of full NIST SSDF certification.
The v1.1 baseline is used for release gating; Rev.1 v1.2 IPD is tracked as forward-looking input.

practices.title: Define Security Requirements for Software Development
practices.summary: Release-critical enforcement and supply-chain controls are tracked as explicit engineering requirements with binary closure criteria.

practices.title: Implement Roles and Responsibilities
practices.summary: Runtime authorization boundaries for enforcement and approvals are role-based with SCIM-aware permission overlays.

practices.title: Implement Supporting Toolchains
practices.summary: CI and supply-chain toolchains are codified for lint, type-check, test, placeholder guard, SBOM/provenance, and attestation verification.

practices.title: Define and Use Criteria for Software Security Checks
practices.summary: Security and quality checks are enforced through deterministic CI gates and coverage thresholds.

practices.title: Implement and Maintain Secure Environments for Software Development
practices.summary: Runtime environment contract checks and deployment guardrails are enforced, with ongoing hardening tracked in the gap register.

practices.title: Protect All Forms of Code from Unauthorized Access and Tampering
practices.summary: Repository and build-path safeguards are enforced in CI, with organizational source-control controls tracked outside this repository.

practices.title: Provide a Mechanism for Verifying Software Release Integrity
practices.summary: SBOM/provenance artifacts are generated and verified with attestation identity constraints before promotion.

practices.title: Archive and Protect Each Software Release
practices.summary: Build artifacts and evidence outputs are retained in CI; retention and archival policy maturity remains a tracked operations concern.

practices.title: Design Software to Meet Security Requirements and Mitigate Security Risks
practices.summary: Enforcement decisioning, immutability, replay controls, and fail-safe behavior are designed as first-class control-plane requirements.

practices.title: Review the Software Design to Verify Compliance with Requirements and Risk Information
practices.summary: Design changes are validated through policy and API contract tests plus release-gate register checkpoints.

practices.title: Reuse Existing, Well-Secured Software When Feasible Instead of Duplicating Functionality
practices.summary: Core security controls are centralized in shared modules and CI scripts; broader third-party component assurance is managed by dependency/security checks.

practices.title: Create Source Code by Adhering to Secure Coding Practices
practices.summary: Strict coding hygiene is enforced via lint/type/test and explicit placeholder/legacy guardrails.

practices.title: Configure the Compilation, Interpreter, and Build Processes to Improve Executable Security
practices.summary: Build and release workflows enforce deterministic checks, environment contracts, and attestable artifact outputs.

practices.title: Review and/or Analyze Human-Readable Code to Identify Vulnerabilities and Verify Compliance with Security Requirements
practices.summary: Static analysis and policy guard checks are mandatory in CI.

practices.title: Test Executable Code to Identify Vulnerabilities and Verify Compliance with Security Requirements
practices.summary: Enforcement and supply-chain paths are covered by unit/integration and contract tests with explicit coverage thresholds.

practices.title: Configure Software to Have Secure Settings by Default
practices.summary: Secure deployment defaults and fail-closed guardrails are codified in chart schema and template-level enforcement.

practices.title: Identify and Confirm Vulnerabilities on an Ongoing Basis
practices.summary: CI performs recurring static and dependency vulnerability checks.

practices.title: Assess, Prioritize, and Remediate Vulnerabilities
practices.summary: Risk and remediation priorities are tracked in the hardening gap register with closure evidence.

practices.title: Analyze Vulnerabilities to Identify Their Root Causes
practices.summary: Incident response requires root-cause and mitigation recording; additional formal RCA templates remain an operational follow-on.
